event.title: was renamed in the early part of 1915

data.event: The community was renamed in the early part of 1915 due to a mix-up in the mail service.
Logging pitprops for the United Kingdom were started in 1915 by John Jennings (contractor).
This industry was closed in 1918 when the sale of pitprops ended.
Lumber camps opened in 1920 but closed during the Depression of the 1930s.

event.title: closed during the Depression of the 1930s

data.event: Lumber camps opened in 1920 but closed during the Depression of the 1930s.
In 1935 the Thistle family started cutting export wood.

event.title: remained a major economic force in Burlington for approx. 30 years

data.event: They remained a major economic force in Burlington for approx. 30 years.
Camps later opened for the cutting of pulpwood and continued for about ten years.

event.title: 1969 pulpwood was again the main industry, shipped

data.event: In 1969 pulpwood was again the main industry, shipped out by truck from Burlington.
